_blog_export.footer:
About

Printscreen is a Plated^ component. It started as a simple lua script to allow screenshots to be uploaded to a website.

Back then (2007!) when it was called, 'sBlog', we had to jump through a few hoops to get this to work. Ultimately, we settled on the simplest and most obvious method - sending a message containing the screenshot using a Gmail account. This worked with any blogging service that supported email hosting which included Flickr, Blogger and Livejournal.

Printscreen is on Github

Click z to zoom, right arrow and left arrow key to navigate.

_blog_export._blog_post_body: New IT Stuff redesign using our new web framework, ^plated. The old server died and became unreliable (we've now moved server and upgraded for less!) so everything went with it. Our previous framework (pagecake) allowed you to edit stuff on the go but it also meant backups were manual which was not ideal. We've learnt a lot from a decade of using the system extensively so ^plated is the end result of all those years.

Colour Gradient
{footer}

_blog_post_json.author: shi
_blog_post_json.title: shi at Thu 12 Jul 16:55:04 BST 2018 on ripley

_blog_export._body:
New IT Stuff redesign using our new web framework, ^plated. The old server died and became unreliable (we've now moved server and upgraded for less!) so everything went with it. Our previous framework (pagecake) allowed you to edit stuff on the go but it also meant backups were manual which was not ideal. We've learnt a lot from a decade of using the system extensively so ^plated is the end result of all those years.
shi at Thu 12 Jul 16:55:04 BST 2018 on ripley

_blog_export._blog_post_body: Flexing old graphic design skills for a concert flyer I'm performing in. Took quite a while for the ol' noggin to get going but when it did, it wouldn't let me stop. Having literally forced myself to stop, there are now just 25 iterations to choose from (all of which I'm not really satisfied with - no surprises there!) - should prolly whittle it down to 5 or something :}

_blog_export._body:
Flexing old graphic design skills for a concert flyer I'm performing in. Took quite a while for the ol' noggin to get going but when it did, it wouldn't let me stop. Having literally forced myself to stop, there are now just 25 iterations to choose from (all of which I'm not really satisfied with - no surprises there!) - should prolly whittle it down to 5 or something :}

_blog_export._blog_post_body: wakey wakey :} Have started writing down some semblance of a story and conversation. I'm trying to take it slow but it's hard when one is excited. wakey wakey :} Have started writing down some semblance of a story and conversation. I'm trying to take it slow but it's hard when one is excited. shi at Mon 29 Jan 23:25:31 GMT 2018 on ripley
_blog_export.footer:
About

Printscreen is a Plated^ component. It started as a simple lua script to allow screenshots to be uploaded to a website.

Back then (2007!) when it was called, 'sBlog', we had to jump through a few hoops to get this to work. Ultimately, we settled on the simplest and most obvious method - sending a message containing the screenshot using a Gmail account. This worked with any blogging service that supported email hosting which included Flickr, Blogger and Livejournal.

Printscreen is on Github

Click z to zoom, right arrow and left arrow key to navigate.

hi!

_blog_export._blog_post_body: Eyes are crossed squinting at the screen - a different pixel here, another pixel there makes an eyeball or an xtra head. I've currently kept animation frames to a minimum but that's enough to create an acceptable breathing sequence. All of the characters have the same treatment for now but that should change later.

_blog_export._body:
Eyes are crossed squinting at the screen - a different pixel here, another pixel there makes an eyeball or an xtra head. I've currently kept animation frames to a minimum but that's enough to create an acceptable breathing sequence. All of the characters have the same treatment for now but that should change later.

_blog_export._blog_post_body: Pixel hunting a body for the avatars. With such limitations, it's quite a challenge to fit all the details I'd have liked to without compromising variety. May stretch the widths of the characters but this might come at a price when animating.

_blog_post_json.title: shi at Sun 14 Jan 22:03:57 GMT 2018 on ripley

_blog_export._body:
Pixel hunting a body for the avatars. With such limitations, it's quite a challenge to fit all the details I'd have liked to without compromising variety. May stretch the widths of the characters but this might come at a price when animating.
